title: Happenings in the lakes area , Nov . 20 - Dec . 1
body_text:
The Detroit Lakes Tribune accepts community calendar items for publication online and, space permitting, in our Wednesday and Saturday print editions. Submissions must be made at least a week in advance of the event date, in writing, to either dltribune@dlnewspapers.com or vgerdes@dlnewspapers.com. Each submission must include the date, time and location of event, and where to go for more information (phone, email and/or website). Also include whether the event is free or paid admission, and how much it costs when applicable.
Wednesday, November 20
Grace Cafe Thanksgiving: Grace Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes will be serving a Thanksgiving turkey dinner from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. The lunch is open to all in the Detroit Lakes area; admission is a free-will donation. Guests are welcome to stay after the meal to play games or cards. This will be the final Grace Cafe meal served until after the holidays, though the food pantry in the church lobby will remain open during office hours, Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to noon.
ADVERTISEMENT
Open Acoustic Jam: Bring your acoustic instruments to the Detroit Lakes Public Library for an unplugged jam session, starting at 5 p.m. All experience levels are welcome to this supportive and family-friendly event. Free and open to the public. Bring your acoustic instrument and come have some fun!
Thursday, November 21
Give to the Max Day: The annual online fundraiser known as Give to the Max Day will impact dozens of schools and nonprofit organizations in the lakes area. Donations made via the website at givemn.org, anytime before midnight on Nov. 22, will help your organization's chances of winning additional prize grants. Some organizations will also be receiving match donations from local businesses and private donors.
Deep Dive DL: Join Project 412's Sarah Hofmann at the Becker County Museum at 8 a.m. for a "Deep Dive DL" conversation with Ruth Hetland about ConseCrate Subscription Box, a service for professionals in the ministry. After enjoying a cup of coffee during Hetland's presentation, attendees will have an opportunity to ask questions about what she said. Free and open to the public.
MN Title Grand Opening: Lakes Title and Minnesota Title have joined forces to become MN Title and will host a ribbon cutting and open house event in their new offices at 819 Washington Ave., Detroit Lakes, from 3 to 5 p.m. All are welcome. There will be prizes, and drinks and appetizers served.
ULTRA Membership Meeting: Anyone who is interested in joining the ULTRA Snowmobile Club is welcome to attend their annual membership meeting at American Legion Post 15 in Detroit Lakes from 7-8 p.m. and enjoy some complimentary chili.
Walk-In Evening Flu Shot Clinic: Essentia Health St. Mary’s-Detroit Lakes Clinic is offering a walk-in flu shot clinic for all ages from 4:30-7:30 p.m. Vaccines are available for people six months of age or older, and flu vaccines are covered by Medicare, Medicaid, and most private insurance. Make your appointment to get a flu shot online at essentiahealth.org/flu.
Friday, November 22
Community Blood Drive: Bremer Bank in downtown Detroit Lakes will host a community blood drive for Vitalant from 9 a.m.-12:30 p.m. To make an appointment to give blood, contact Laura at lckoenig@bremer.com or book it online at donors.vitalant.org to reserve your spot.
ADVERTISEMENT
Festival of Trees: The 8th Annual Lakes Crisis and Resource Center Festival of Trees will take place at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn from 5:30 to 8 p.m. The evening will include a dinner, a silent auction featuring festive holiday decor, and a live tree auction with trees decorated and donated by local businesses. There will also be a few games of chance throughout the evening, and a cash bar. Tickets are $50 each and may be purchased online at lakescrisis.com/donate (please put FOT in the note area) or in person at the LCRC offices, located at 1339 Pelican Lane in Detroit Lakes. Contact Stephanie at 218-847-8572 or stephanieb@lakescrisis.com for more information. All proceeds from the benefit will go to support the non-profit LCRC and its programming.
Stained Glass Holiday Ornament Workshop: Come learn the basics of stained glass art from Studio Renaissance instructor Ramon Morin at the Holmes Art Cellar, located in the basement of the Historic Holmes Theatre at 806 Summit Ave., Detroit Lakes. The class will start at 5:30 p.m., and will run approximately three hours. Class is intended for artists age 16 and up; cost is $100 per person, which includes all stained glass-making supplies. Sign up online at dlccc.org/artcellar.html, or call 218-844-7469.
38 Special Concert: Southern rock icons 38 Special will take the Event Center stage at Mahnomen's Shooting Star Casino for an 8 p.m. concert. Tickets are available online at the website, starcasino.com, as well as at the casino box office.
Live Music: Seth Moore at the Sandbar II in Detroit Lakes, 6:30 p.m.; Adios Pantalones at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn, 9 p.m.
Saturday, November 23
Holiday Open House at Marshmallow: The Marshmallow Animal Shelter and Boarding Facility at 1467 Mallard St., Detroit Lakes, will host a holiday open house from 10 a.m.-3 p.m. There will be a bake sale, silent auction, photos with Santa, 2025 raffle calendars on sale, and a variety of other vendors on site, including an opportunity to get your pet microchipped for just $20. Call 218-847-9040 for more information.
Family and Pet Santa Photos: Becker Pet and Garden in downtown Detroit Lakes (1008 Washington Ave.) will host an opportunity to get your family holiday photos with Santa taken, with pets included, from 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Walk-ins welcome; no reservations needed. Cost is $30 per session; proceeds will benefit the Humane Society of the Lakes. Please call the Humane Society at 218-847-0511 or message them via their Facebook page for more information.
Christmas Kickoff at Ella Marie's: Santa and Mrs. Claus will be at Ella Marie's in rural Lake Park from 9-11 a.m., and there will also be free kids' crafts, family holiday photo opportunities, festive music and plenty of in-store specials and holiday treats from 8 a.m.-2 p.m.
ADVERTISEMENT
Acrylic Painting 101: Join Detroit Lakes artist Anna Lassonde at the Holmes Art Cellar, located in the basement of the Historic Holmes Theatre at 806 Summit Ave., Detroit Lakes, for a 1 p.m. class on acrylic painting basics. Bring along a reference object or photo that you would like to paint, or use one of those provided by the instructor. All supplies are provided, but you are welcome to bring your own. Available canvas sizes are 8x10 and 11x14 inches. Cost is $65 per person; class is intended for artists age 16 and up. Sign up online at dlccc.org/artcellar.html, or call 218-844-7469.
Lakes Area Community Concert Band: The fall concert of the Lakes Area Community Concert Band will take place at Detroit Lakes' Historic Holmes Theatre, starting at 4 p.m. The performance will include a special guest appearance by clarinet soloist, Dr. Leigh Wakefield. The concert is free and open to the public, though a free will offering will be taken to help support the musicians. Visit lakesareaband.com for more information about the group.
Girls Night Out Bingo-Taylor's Version: Join the Detroit Lakes Jaycees at the National Guard Armory, 1220 Rossman Ave., for some "girls night out"-themed bingo, and be sure to dress in attire from your favorite Taylor Swift music era. Doors open at 6 p.m., with daubers up at 7 p.m. Cost is $40 for 10 games; tickets are available at Lakes Sport Shop in downtown Detroit Lakes.
Eagles Prom Night Celebration: Join Eagles Aerie 2342 at the Eagles Club, 112 W. Holmes St., Detroit Lakes, for an enchanted evening of dance and music with your loved one from 7-11 p.m. There will be music from Matty B, drink specials, and prizes for the evening's king and queen. All ages are welcome.
Kip Peltoniemi Concert: The New York Mills Regional Cultural Center will host a 7:30 p.m. concert by accordion player Kip Peltoniemi that is co-sponsored by the New York Mills Friends of the Library. Peltoniemi, whose music defies genres and stereotypes, has played in several U.S. states, recorded in Finland and had his songs played on European radio. Adult admission is $10 in advance or $12 at the door; members receive a $2 discount. Student tickets are always $5 each. Sign up online at kulcher.org or call 218-385-3339 to reserve your seats.
Live Music: Brianna Helbling and Rachael Ianiro at Cormorant Pub and Boathouse in Cormorant, 7 p.m.; Matt Morse at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquors in Audubon, 8 p.m.; Sam & Chris from Kissing Company at The Roadhouse in Cormorant, 8 p.m.; Romyn & Rick at Zorbaz in Detroit Lakes, 9 p.m.; Adios Pantalones at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn, 9 p.m.
Sunday, November 24
All Together for Alden: The Becker County Museum will host a benefit for Alden Mitchell from 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Alden, who was born on Nov. 5, has been diagnosed with a rare congenital heart disorder that made it necessary for doctors to operate less than a week after his birth; two more surgeries will be needed during his childhood years to mitigate the effects of Hypoplastic Left Heart Syndrome, or HLHS. The benefit will include a hot dog and chili bar, silent auction, kids' games in the science center, family photo sessions with photographer Annie Minske, and an opportunity to watch the Minnesota Vikings-Chicago Bears football game on any of the museum's giant, 90-inch Promethean screens (the museum will remain open until the conclusion of the game). Cost is $20 per family for the photo session, or a free will donation for both the food and silent auction items (auction will close at 2:30 p.m.). There will also be a cash bar provided by La Barista, which is catering the event. Proceeds will go to support the Mitchell family.
ADVERTISEMENT
Thankful Treats Packaging and Distribution: Join the congregation of Zion Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes from 12-1:30 p.m. and help package treats for delivery to community members. Sign up in the church hallway at 1100 Lake Ave. between now and the event to offer to bring treats, help with packaging or be a part of the delivery crew. Zion is also hosting a food drive for the Becker County Food Pantry through Nov. 27, so you could also bring in a non-perishable food item or a cash donation to help that effort as well.
Turkey Bingo: The Callaway Lions Club will host an evening of Turkey Bingo at the Callaway Event Center (403 Main Ave.) at 7 p.m. Questions? Call 218-234-8931.
Monday, November 25
Anime and Manga Club: Anime and manga fans are invited to geek out over their favorite shows and stories, starting at 4 p.m. at the Detroit Lakes Public Library, 1000 Washington Ave. This month's attendees will be making food from Japanese recipes inspired by the delicious meals in anime; highlighted shows will include "Naruto," "The Disastrous Life of Saika K," and"Sweetness and Lightning." Open to all area teens (age 13 and up) who are interested in joining. No cost to attend.
Wednesday, November 27
Live Music Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store in Audubon will host an evening of pre-Thanksgiving karaoke starting at 8 p.m.; Mike Hokanson will be at Cormorant Pub and Boathouse in Cormorant from 7 p.m.
Thursday, November 28
HAPPY THANKSGIVING!
Holy Rosary Thanksgiving Feast: Holy Rosary Catholic Church in Detroit Lakes will be hosting a Community Thanksgiving Feast from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. in the Parish Center at 1043 Lake Ave. Dine-in, delivery and takeout options available; please call 218-847-1393 by Nov. 25 to reserve meals for delivery or pickup. Free will donations are accepted, but not required; the meal is a gift to the community.
Friday, November 29
Free Park Day: All Minnesota state parks and recreation areas will be offering free admission all day long (though this does not cover the cost of amenity or user fees for activities like camping, rentals or special tours). Come explore Maplewood, Glendalough, Buffalo River, Itasca — all within a 50-mile radius of Detroit Lakes — or any of the other beautiful state parks and recreation areas in the state. A full list is available at dnr.state.mn.us/state_parks/list_alpha.html. Questions? Call 651-296-6157 or 888-646-6367, or send an email to info.dnr@state.mn.us.
ADVERTISEMENT
Santa and Live Reindeer at Cwikla Hardware: Santa and Mrs. Claus will be bringing some of their favorite (live) reindeer to Cwikla Hardware in Detroit Lakes for their annual visit, from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. No cost to come have your photos taken with the Clauses and their reindeer. Open to the public.
Black Friday Cosmic Bingo: Detroit Lakes VFW Post 1676 will host an evening of Cosmic Bingo starting at 7 p.m. Grab your fluorescent daubers and head on over to the VFW for a fun evening as they "put the lights down low and let it glow." Cost is $1 per bingo card; 11 games in all. There will also be electronic racing, meat raffles and door prize giveaways throughout the evening.
Live Music: Javier Quiroz at Sandbar II in Detroit Lakes, 6:30 p.m.; Terry Mackner at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store in Audubon, 8 p.m.; Day of Bliss at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn, 9 p.m.
Saturday, November 30
Small Business Saturday: Be sure to come out and support your local small businesses during regular business hours. Many will be having in-store specials and activities throughout the day.
Santa's Workshop at the Museum: Come to the Becker County Museum in Detroit Lakes between 10 a.m.-noon for some Famiy Day activities in "Santa's Workshop." Decorate a sugar cookie, mail a letter to Santa, "stuff-a-plush" wearing holiday jammies, enjoy a drink from the hot cocoa bar and try some make-and-take crafts (all while supplies last). Cost for different activities will vary; some are free. Open to the public. The museum is located at 714 Summit Ave.
Live Music: Matt Aakre at The Roadhouse in Cormorant, 8 p.m.; Day of Bliss at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn, 9 p.m.; Hardwood Groove at Zorbaz in Detroit Lakes, 9:30 p.m.
Sunday, December 1
Lakes Area Chorale Meet and Greet: The Lakes Area Chorale will be doing a meet and greet as a preview to their 2025 season, celebrating “100 Years of Broadway,” from 1-2:30 p.m. at First Lutheran Church, 912 Lake Ave., Detroit Lakes. If you are interested in being part of the Lakes Area Chorale, or even finding out what this community choir is all about, come meet some of its singers, past and present. You will also be able to sign up for the new season; membership fee is $50 per person, which includes a copy of all the sheet music for the season, as well as an MP3 copy of the performance. Rehearsals are held at First Lutheran every Sunday from 2-4 p.m., Jan. 5–March 23, with a final dress rehearsal set for Saturday, March 29 from 2-8 p.m., followed by the end-of-season concert at the Historic Holmes Theatre in Detroit Lakes on Sunday, March 30 at 4 p.m. For more information, call or text chorale director Barb Schramm at 218-443-0697.
ADVERTISEMENT
Multi-day and Recurring Events
Willy Wonka at Lake Park-Audubon: Lake Park-Audubon High School's theater department will be presenting "Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka" in three separate performances, Friday, Nov. 22 at 7 p.m., and Saturday, Nov. 23 at both 2 and 7 p.m., in the LPA High School Theater. Open to the public. A special "dinner theater" event will be held starting at 5 p.m. on Saturday, with a Wonka-inspired meal followed by the final performance of "Willy Wonka" in the theater. Tickets are available in the LPA High School office; cost is $8 for adults, $5 for students (all seniors and LPA students will be admitted free of charge). Dinner theater tickets are $35 each, which includes the meal.
Lake Park Parade of Trees: The Lake Park American Legion will host the community's annual Parade of Trees from Thursday, Nov. 28 through Sunday, Dec. 1. Dozens of trees decorated by local businesses, groups, organizations and individuals will be on display starting on Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, Nov. 28, from 4-8 p.m. Additional viewing hours will be from 10 a.m.-7 p.m. on Friday and Saturday, Nov. 29-30, as well as from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. on Sunday, Dec. 1. Take-down of the trees will start at 4:30 p.m. Sunday. Free will donations to support the annual event will be accepted, and refreshments will be served.
Young Life Tree Sales: Lakes Area Young Life will be selling Christmas trees every Friday, Saturday and Sunday from Nov. 22-Dec. 15 at 802 West Lake Drive in Detroit Lakes (parking lot of the old West Lake Laundry). Hours are 4-7 p.m. on Fridays (except Nov. 29 when sales begin at 10 a.m.) and 10 a.m.-7 p.m. on both Saturdays and Sundays. Trees vary in height from 6-13 feet, and selection includes Frasier, Canaan, Korean and Balsam firs as well as white pine.
TEACH Gallery Exhibit: Artists Peder Butenhoff and Michael Aasness are featured in "TEACH," a new exhibit on display at the New York Mills Regional Cultural Center from now through Saturday, Nov. 30, when a closing reception for the artists will be held from 1-3 p.m. The exhibit also pays tribute to Jim Borgreen, who was Butenhoff's art teacher — while Butenhoff was Aasness's art teacher — and showcases the role teachers play in providing both knowledge and inspiration to upcoming artists. The exhibit is free and open to the public during the Center's regular hours, 10 a.m.-7 p.m. on both Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Fridays and 10 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturdays. It is closed from Sunday through Tuesday. Call 218-385-3339 or email cheryl@kulcher.org with any questions or to schedule a private gallery viewing.
Troll Trails Closed: The trails leading to the "Trolls in DL" public art sculptures in Detroit Lakes and Frazee will be temporarily closed for the Minnesota deer hunting season until Nov. 24, to ensure the safety of our troll-hunting visitors. "Alexa's Elixir" in the City Park will remain open, with the other five sculptures to reopen to the public on Monday, Nov. 25.
American Adventure Exhibit: The Becker County Museum in Detroit Lakes will be hosting the traveling exhibit, "American Adventure," through May 24, 2025. This 3,000-square-foot, interactive history exhibit will be located on the museum's basement level, and consists of a realistic, "choose-your-adventure" maze where visitors can learn about one of America's earliest pioneer settlements, Jamestown, Virginia, and see if they have what it takes to survive under the conditions that the settlers experienced back in 1607. Cost is $20 for adults, $10 for kids (museum members receive a 50% discount). There are also group rates and pre-visit lesson plans available for student tours. Hours are 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Tuesday through Saturday. Contact the museum at 218-847-2938 or visit the exhibit's Facebook event page for more information.
Heart O'Lakes Harmony: The Heart O'Lakes Harmony men's barbershop-style a capella choral group is looking for new members. Anyone who enjoys singing is welcome to come join their weekly practices, every Monday at 7 p.m. in Faith Lutheran Church, 423 S. Broadway, Pelican Rapids (located across the street from the high school). There will be a concert at 3 p.m. on Dec. 8 in Trinity Lutheran Church, Pelican Rapids. For more information please contact Harlan Hoff at 701-306-8976.
Sleeping Bags Needed: The Holy Rosary Knights of Columbus in Detroit Lakes are collecting sleeping bags for distribution to those in need. Anyone who has a new or used, functional sleeping bag (i.e., the zipper works) can drop them off at the Becker County Food Pantry, 610 Terry St., Detroit Lakes, anytime between 8 a.m.-3 p.m. on Tuesdays and Thursdays. For more information contact Brad Carlson at 218-234-4448.
Grace Food Pantry: Grace Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes will be operating a food pantry during its regular office hours, 9 a.m.- noon Monday through Friday. Anyone in need can come in and pick up some food. Donations will also be accepted.
TOPS Meeting: The local chapter of Take Off Pounds Sensibly (TOPS) meets weekly on Thursday mornings at Trinity Lutheran Church, 1401 Madison Ave., Detroit Lakes. Weigh-in begins at 8:20 a.m., meeting at 9 a.m. Contact Carol at 218-841-0226 or Coleen at 218-841-2877 for more information. All are welcome; first session is free.
Library Storytime: The Detroit Lakes Public Library offers weekly Preschool Storytime sessions every Thursday at 10:30 a.m. Preschoolers and their caregivers/families are invited to join library staff for stories, flannel boards, finger plays, songs and more. This early literacy experience explores a different theme each week and is a way to encourage young children to enjoy reading. Call 218-847-2168 for more information.
Celebrate Recovery: The Celebrate Recovery group meets every Tuesday, 6:30-8 p.m. at Christian Fellowship Church, 28048 Meadow Drive, Detroit Lakes, to take the next steps on the "Road to Recovery: Eight Principles Based on the Beatitudes, Twelve Steps and their Biblical Comparison." Many struggle with alcoholism, divorce, sexual abuse, codependency, domestic violence, drug addiction, food and gambling addictions. Celebrate Recovery is a tried and proven format to help you walk through life's struggles. Men and women meet in a large group format, then break off into smaller discussion groups; men with men, women with women. Come as you are. No cost. We are here to help. Unfortunately, no childcare is available at this time. For more information, check out the website at celebraterecovery.com or call us at 218-234-2496.
Caring Cup Grief Support: The Caring Cup, a gathering of community members who are dealing with the loss of a loved one, will meet at the David-Donehower Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes on the second Wednesday of every month; the Furey Funeral Home in Frazee on every third Wednesday, and West-Kjos Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes on every fourth Wednesday. All meetings take place from 10:30 to 11:30 a.m., and offer a relaxed time to face the challenges of life after loss, together. For more information, call Mary Swenson at 218-847-4147.
Trivia Nights: Lakeside Tavern in Detroit Lakes hosts a Trivia Night every Monday from 7 to 9 p.m. Event takes place in Lakeside Tavern's upstairs space, so seating is limited. Open to the public.
GED/Adult Diploma Instruction: If finishing high school is still on your “to-do” list, it is never too late!! Lakes Area Adult Education is open and ready to help you meet your goals. Orientation sessions for GED or Adult Diploma classes take place twice a month, so get in touch and get started now! Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us. Additional Adult Education offerings and associated flyers can always be found at dlschools.net/departments/community-education.
Free ESL Instruction: Free English as a Second Language instruction is offered for adults in the Detroit Lakes Area, every Monday through Thursday (holidays excepted) at Lakes Area Adult Education. The schedule is flexible and individualized. Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information. Additional Adult Education offerings and associated flyers can always be found at dlschools.net/departments/community-education.
Minnesota Driver's License Exam Preparation: Detroit Lakes Adult Basic Education offers virtual classes that are designed to help unlicensed adult drivers become familiar with vocabulary, signs and rules of the road so they can successfully pass the written portion of the Minnesota Driver’s License Exam. Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information. Additional Adult Education offerings and associated flyers can always be found at communityed.dlschools.net.
DL Cloggers: The DL Cloggers meet to dance and socialize every Tuesday (excluding holidays) at 1 p.m. in the basement of Detroit Lakes VFW Post 1676. No prior dance experience necessary. For more information, call Ruby at 218-847-7741.
HR Connect: The Detroit Lakes Chamber is hosting an opportunity for human resources professionals, business owners and managers to connect, every first Thursday of the month at 8:15 a.m. at the Chamber office at 700 Summit Ave. Discuss human resource topics, share best practices and review data to help attract, retain and grow the workforce for the lakes region. Event is free for Chamber members, $10 for non-members.
Baby Bounce: Songs, stories, and action poems for infants, toddlers and their caregivers are offered every Monday at the Detroit Lakes Public Library at 10:30 a.m. Program runs about a half hour including playtime and chatting with other caregivers. For ages 0-18 months. Call 218-847-2168 for more information.
Alcoholics Anonymous: Detroit Lakes' Alano Club meets at 827 Summit Ave. on the following days and times: Sundays at 1 p.m., 12x12 open meeting; Tuesdays at 7 p.m., Big Book open meeting; Wednesdays at noon, Grapevine open meeting; Wednesdays at 6 p.m., women's open meeting; Thursdays at 7 p.m., Intro to AA open meeting; Saturdays at 7 a.m., men's open meeting; Saturdays at 9 a.m., Women's Big Book closed meeting; Saturdays at 8 p.m., open topic meeting. There are no dues or fees for meetings. For more information, call 218-844-9970 or the District 3 AA Helpline at 877-833-2327.
Holy Rosary Al-Anon Meeting: There will be an Al-Anon meeting every Thursday, starting at noon, inside Holy Rosary Catholic Church, 1043 Lake Ave., Detroit Lakes. There is also an Al-Anon meeting at 7 p.m. every Tuesday at the Alano Club at 827 Summit Ave. in Detroit Lakes.
Overeaters Anonymous: A 12-step program for those who struggle in their relationship with food, Overeaters Anonymous continues to meet at noon every Tuesday at Holy Rosary Catholic Church in Detroit Lakes. There is no charge to attend. Contact Debbie C. at 218-234-3071. Another group also meets on Sunday nights at 6 p.m. via Zoom. This is a change of venue as of Oct. 9. Please call Sharon R. at 1-701-388-7585 or Hailee S. at 1-701-212-7904 for information if you plan to join the Zoom meeting. There is no charge to participate.
Compiled by Vicki Gerdes for the Detroit Lakes Tribune.
